isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - LOWER REVERSE IDLER GEAR

figure.caption: Figure 129. Lower Reverse Idler Gear Assembly
Figure 130. Lower Reverse Idler Gear Assembly

step1.para: Position the reverse idler bearing and inner race into the reverse idler gear.

Hold the reverse idler gear and flat thrust washer in place in the main case, and insert the idler shaft, threaded end to the front, through the rear case bore and into the gear. Do not insert the reverse idler shaft into the main case support boss at this time.

Position the slotted thrust washer in front of the gear with a slot facing up. Note the word FRONT on the slotted washer, and make sure it faces the front of the transmission. Continue to feed the idler shaft forward through this washer and into the hole in the case boss.
Slide the reverse idler shaft into the support boss bore, and with a soft bar and driver, drive the reverse idler shaft fully into position ( Figure 131).
Secure the shaft in position according to one of the procedures below:

Inspect the nylon locking insert in the nut, and replace the nut if it is excessively worn. After inspecting and/or replacing the nut, install the nut and washer on shaft front. Tighten the nut to 91 to 102 Nm (67 to 75 ft-lbs).
Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolt threads and install the bolt and washer. Tighten the bolt to 91 to 102 Nm (67 to 75 ft-lbs).
